content.text: table is designed to store data related to meter readings and billing periods for Con Edison, a utility company. This table captures detailed information about meter readings, billing cycles, and associated metadata such as account numbers, meter numbers, and service addresses. It also includes fields for tracking the creation and update timestamps, as well as user authentication details.
The complexity of this table is considered medium due to the following factors:
It contains a moderate number of columns (25), which include a mix of data types and default values.
The table uses user-defined functions for default values, which adds a layer of complexity.
It has a single primary key index but no foreign keys or additional indexes, which simplifies relationships but impact performance.
, which is an integer and ensures uniqueness for each record.

, which optimizes retrieval by this unique identifier.
This table is used in the context of utility billing and meter management. Potential use cases include:
Storing and retrieving historical meter readings for billing purposes.
Tracking changes in billing periods and revisions.
Managing customer account and meter information for service delivery.
Supporting reporting and analysis of utility consumption and billing trends.
: The primary key constraint ensures that each record is unique.

: Several columns have default values set via user-defined functions, which help maintain data consistency and reduce the need for manual data entry.
